intro: Nototriche ecuadoriensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of yellow to orange hues. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
